sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A prospect of eternity or Mans everlasting condition opened and applyed. By John Wells Master of Arts, sometimes Fellow of St. Johns Colledge in Oxford, and now Pastour of Olaves Jewry LONDON. Wells, John, 1623-1676.
[24], 409, [5] p.
Printed by E.C. for Joseph Cranford at the Phoenix in St. Pauls-church-yard, London : 1655. [i.e. 1654]
Imprimatur leaf dated Septemb. 8. 1654. With two final advertisement leaves. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octob. 10. 1654"; the second 5 in the imprint date has been crossed out. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A prospect of eternity or Mans everlasting condition opened and applyed. By John Wells Master of Arts, sometimes Fellow of St. Johns Colledge in Oxford, and now Pastour of Olaves Jewry LONDON. Wells, John, 1623-1676.
[24], 409, [5] p.
Printed by E.C. for Joseph Cranford at the Phoenix in St. Pauls-church-yard, London : 1655. [i.e. 1654]
Imprimatur leaf dated Septemb. 8. 1654. With two final advertisement leaves. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octob. 10. 1654"; the second 5 in the imprint date has been crossed out. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Joseph Cranford
E.C.
the Phoenix in St. Pauls-church-yard
